content:
• Monday, July 1, 2013
  • ACUR

    Shares of Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR) had a solid day today, finishing up over 18% after...

    Shares of Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR) had a solid day today, finishing up over 18% after the company said Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) will expand commercialization of Oxecta Tablets to health care providers in Q4. These campaign will be directed towards a national cross section of healthcare professionals who treat pain, but will not include the use of field representatives. OTC:ACUR receives tiered royalties ranging from 5% to 25% on net sales the pain killer.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 PM
  • SLAB

    Silicon Labs (NASDAQ:SLAB) says it's completed its acquisition of Energy Micro AS, giving it...

    Silicon Labs (NASDAQ:SLAB) says it's completed its acquisition of Energy Micro AS, giving it entrance into the smart energy, home automation, security and portable electronics markets. The deal's closing means Energy Micro will receive an up-front payment of $115M in cash, plus approximately $55M in deferred and earn-out consideration. Shares -3.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 PM
  • HDSN

    Hudson Technologies (NASDAQ:HDSN) gets hammered in the post-session after the industrial...

    Hudson Technologies (NASDAQ:HDSN) gets hammered in the post-session after the industrial equipment wholesaler says it expects to report Q2 earnings in a range from $0.00 to $0.01 per share, trailing Street estimates by at least $0.14 per share. Revenue declined 29.5% Y/Y to $15.5M, also lagging analyst expectations of $24.67M. The company cites unusually cool spring weather for lower sales of air conditioning equipment for the miss. Shares -24.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:29 PM
  • DVA

    DaVita HealthCare (NYSE:DVA) slips in the post-session on reports the U.S. Medicare program...

    DaVita HealthCare (NYSE:DVA) slips in the post-session on reports the U.S. Medicare program plans to cut payments to dialysis centers by 9.4% next year, according to a proposal posted online Monday afternoon. Cuts are part of a budget balancing law passed last year. Fresenius Medical Care (NYSE:FMS) also trades lower on the news. DVA -5.5%, FMS -1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • TRP

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TRP +8%. XRTX +6%. ZNGA +6%. TSPT +4%. NWS +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TRP +8%. XRTX +6%. ZNGA +6%. TSPT +4%. NWS +3%.
    After-hours top losers: ACHN -22%. FMS -7%. GSE -2%. THO -2%. TEO -1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • AVGO

    More on Lazard's downgrade of Broadcom (BRCM -1.8%) and upgrade of Marvell (MRVL +0.4%): analyst...

    More on Lazard's downgrade of Broadcom (BRCM -1.8%) and upgrade of Marvell (MRVL +0.4%): analyst Daniel Amir argues Broadcom's (dominant) combo chip share has nowhere to go but down, that 4G LTE baseband chip sales will take time, and that heavy investments/opex spell a lack of operating leverage. Meanwhile, he thinks rival Marvell's 3G baseband business could be a positive catalyst: the company has launched quad-core chips, is expanding beyond China, and has scored design wins with Samsung, Huawei, ZTE, and HTC.  Moreover, the baseband wins could lead to combo chip wins. Brean upgraded Marvell last week. (Broadcom 3G basebands)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • ACHN

    Achillion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACHN) resumes trading, now -20% AH.

    Achillion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACHN) resumes trading, now -20% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • SHLM

    Shares of A. Schulman (NASDAQ:SHLM) resume trading, currently -14% AH.

    Shares of A. Schulman (NASDAQ:SHLM) resume trading, currently -14% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • AMBT

    Annual reconstitution of Russell’s U.S. indexes may help explain some of today's big...

    Annual reconstitution of Russell’s U.S. indexes may help explain some of today's big movers among smallcaps; the event typically is viewed as a trading opportunity. Among Russell deletions: AMBT +22.4%, OTC:ACUR +18%, DM +14.7%, OTC:FALC -12.4%, CDZI +12.4%, HNR +10.9%, Among additions: INSM -18.7%, TXMD -13.5%, YRCW +10%. (full list)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 5 Comments
  • AFOP

    Alliance Fiber (NASDAQ:AFOP) +4.4% AH after announcing it expects to post Q2 revenue of $19M+,...

    Alliance Fiber (NASDAQ:AFOP) +4.4% AH after announcing it expects to post Q2 revenue of $19M+, above prior guidance of $16M and a $16.2M consensus. The company adds customer demand "remained strong till the end of quarter." SA contributor Inflection Point Investing recently declared the passive optical component vendor, along with peer NeoPhotonics and system vendor Infinera, to be play on soaring 100G optical networking hardware demand. Shares rose 9.4% in regular trading. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • SHLM

    A. Schulman (NASDAQ:SHLM): Q3 misses hard across the board as net sales declined by 3% year over...

    A. Schulman (NASDAQ:SHLM): Q3 misses hard across the board as net sales declined by 3% year over year. Additionally, the company lowers FY13 EPS guidance to $1.70 - $1.80  from $2.08 - $2.13, missing the Street's per-share expectation of $2.01. It cites continued inconsistency in European markets and additional costs in Latin America for the downward revision. Shares currently halted AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • XRTX

    Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX): FQ2 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $216.2M beats by $13.04M....

    Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX): FQ2 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $216.2M beats by $13.04M. Shares +1.23% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • ONXX

    $160/share is apparently the Street high takeout target for Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +50.9%)...

    $160/share is apparently the Street high takeout target for Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +50.9%) and it comes from Brean Capital's Gene Mack who says it "reflects a multiple of peak sales of three times the estimate of the company's key drug of $4B in sales [which is] rather conservative and well-within the range of other biotech deals." Other numbers being thrown about are $130-140/share from Maxim Group and $140-150 from Bernstein and Deutsche.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • GNVC

    GenVec (GNVC +2.8%) says it's terminating the employment of 30 of its remaining 41 employees....

    GenVec (GNVC +2.8%) says it's terminating the employment of 30 of its remaining 41 employees. The termination is expected to be completed effective June 30, 2013. It estimates that about $311,785 of expenses will be incurred in Q2 due to the position eliminations. The move comes as no surprise, considering that its board announced late last month that it had approved the liquidation and dissolution of the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • HFC

    Refiners HollyFrontier (HFC -5.2%), Marathon Petroleum (MPC -0.7%) and Valero (VLO -1.4%) are...

    Refiners HollyFrontier (HFC -5.2%), Marathon Petroleum (MPC -0.7%) and Valero (VLO -1.4%) are downgraded to Underweight from Neutral at J.P. Morgan, which says traditionally weaker H2 results and narrowing differentials between Brent prices and WTI will keep shares range-bound even as the companies' long-term finances still look good. The firm prefers Phillips 66 (PSX +0.1%) and Tesoro (TSO -0.6%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARRY

    Array Biopharma's (ARRY +4%) ARRY-520 is an underappreciated play on multiple myeloma, Wells...

    Array Biopharma's (ARRY +4%) ARRY-520 is an underappreciated play on multiple myeloma, Wells Fargo's Matthew Adams says, and recent action (Onyx/Amgen and Celgene/ MorphoSys) indicates "significant interest" in the space.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • XLS

    ITT Exelis (XLS +2.5%) trades up today after saying it's been selected by Raytheon Company...

    ITT Exelis (XLS +2.5%) trades up today after saying it's been selected by Raytheon Company (NYSE:RTN) to supply antenna subsystems for the DoD's international ballistic defense system. The antennas will be fielded as part of the Standard Missile-3 program, a cooperative development program between the U.S. Department of Defense and the Ministry of Defense of Japan, scheduled to be deployed in 2018.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • MMSI

    Merit Medical Systems (MMSI +2%) says it's received 510(k) clearance from the FDA for its...

    Merit Medical Systems (MMSI +2%) says it's received 510(k) clearance from the FDA for its basixTOUCH, a high-pressure inflation device. The company also announced that it has been notified by its embolic business partner in Japan, Nippon Kayaku, that it has received approval from Japan's Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency for Embosphere and HepaSphere Microspheres as medical devices for arterial embolization in patients with hypervascular tumors and arteriovenous malformations.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • EOG

    EOG Resources (EOG +3%) is on the move as Jefferies raises its target price for the Buy-rated...

    EOG Resources (EOG +3%) is on the move as Jefferies raises its target price for the Buy-rated shares to $174 from $160, predicting new techniques could soon boost production at its Eagle Ford wells. The firm says EOG is drilling some of the best shale wells on the eastern part of its acreage; its western wells aren't as strong but are improving, helped by the use of more advanced technology.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • ASRV

    AmeriServ Financial (ASRV +9.1%) bounces back from a big Friday loss with SA Pro author...

    AmeriServ Financial (ASRV +9.1%) bounces back from a big Friday loss with SA Pro author Intangible Valuation pointing out this morning (embargoed until Tuesday) not to expect the Pennsylvania community bank to continue trading at a 20% discount to tangible book value for long.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • CDE

    Coeur d'Alene (CDE -3.4%) shares have been slashed by BMO's downgrade, but the firm also cut...

    Coeur d'Alene (CDE -3.4%) shares have been slashed by BMO's downgrade, but the firm also cut four other miners to Underperform, including Barrick Gold (ABX -2.3%), whose deferral of the Pascua-Lama project is "a step in the right direction" toward reducing company-wide costs. Also lowered are three silver producers (I, II, III): Pan American (PAAS +2.1%), Endeavour (EXK -1.1%) and Fortuna (FSM -3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • ACTG

    Acacia (ACTG +5.2%) outperforms after acquiring 4 fresh sets of patent portfolios (I, II, III,...

    Acacia (ACTG +5.2%) outperforms after acquiring 4 fresh sets of patent portfolios (I, II, III, IV), and announcing licensing deals (I, II, III) with VMware (NYSE:VMW) and 2 other companies. The patent purchases are related to consumer electronics content security, printing tech, and high-speed circuit interconnect and display control. The non-printing patents were acquired from an unnamed "major semiconductor technology company." The VMware deal resolves an existing infringement suit.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • GD

    General Dynamics (GD +1.1%) Electric Boat division lands a $208.6M contract modification to buy...

    General Dynamics (GD +1.1%) Electric Boat division lands a $208.6M contract modification to buy long lead-time material for three Virginia-class submarines. GD will start construction of two submarines per year beginning in 2011, and covers the Virginia-class submarine, SSN-793, and two FY 15 submarines, SSN-794 and SSN-795.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • GLUU

    For whatever reason, Glu Mobile (GLUU +6.3%) has rallying in sympathy with Zynga following an...

    For whatever reason, Glu Mobile (GLUU +6.3%) has rallying in sympathy with Zynga following an AllThingsD report stating Microsoft Xbox division Don Mattrick could soon be named Zynga's CEO. 25.1% of Glu's float was shorted as of June 14, and shares closed on Friday not too far from their 52-week low of $1.99.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • QIHU

    Qihoo (QIHU +1.9%) is beta-testing a mobile search engine to go with Wi-Fi routers and...

    Qihoo (QIHU +1.9%) is beta-testing a mobile search engine to go with Wi-Fi routers and English-language versions of its 360 PC/mobile security apps, says Stifel, which calls the company "in the midst of an innovation wave" and is raising its PT to $55. The launch of a mobile search engine would amount to additional competition for Baidu (BIDU -1.9%), which now has 100M+ mobile search daily users (monetization is still a work-in-progress). An English version of Qihoo's 360 Mobile Safe app would likely compete with NQ Mobile's (NQ +4.6%) apps. (Baidu PC security app)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • INO

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals (INO +15.8%) pop on a new report from the Center for Infectious Disease...

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals (INO +15.8%) pop on a new report from the Center for Infectious Disease Research and Policy at the University of Minnesota, centering around H7N9 influenza in China and risks to infection. The three main drivers of the report were direct contact with poultry or birds, environmental exposure, and chronic conditions except for hypertension. INO recently announced that a preclinical study of its influenza DNA vaccine against H7N9 achieved immune response levels exceeding those considered to be protective levels in other common influenza subtypes.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • RTN

    Raytheon (RTN +0.7%) has been awarded a contract with the U.S. Naval Air Systems Command to...

    Raytheon (RTN +0.7%) has been awarded a contract with the U.S. Naval Air Systems Command to build an integrated multi-INT system to safeguard forward deployed forces. The cross-domain surveillance system is a software package small enough to mount onboard an aircraft, and transfers sensor data, high-definition surveillance video, and traditional and non-traditional ISR imagery, as well as situational awareness data, to give warfighters an advantage by providing a complete picture of impending threats.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • DOLNQ

    Shares of The Dolan Company (DM +13.5%) soar after SA Pro contributor Colin King's positive...

    Shares of The Dolan Company (DM +13.5%) soar after SA Pro contributor Colin King's positive writeup comes out of embargo over the weekend. Although "patience is a must with this name," King says a "growing backlog in mortgage defaults" bodes well for the company as does Nantahala Capital's recent move to increase its stake to 11%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 4 Comments
  • LGND

    Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND +7.8%) posts solid gains as its Captisol licensee Onyx is the...

    Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND +7.8%) posts solid gains as its Captisol licensee Onyx is the subject of takeout talk. Cantor's Irina Rivkind isn't getting too excited though, as a "Promacta generic filer [or] any potential near-term weakness in Kyprolis or Promacta performance relative to consensus," could send the shares lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • BKR

    Michael Baker Corporation (BKR +0.8%) says its Michael Baker Jr. unit has been awarded a...

    Michael Baker Corporation (BKR +0.8%) says its Michael Baker Jr. unit has been awarded a four-year, $2.12M construction, engineering and inspection contract by the Tennessee Department of Transportation. The contract is for the replacement of a bridge over the French Broad River in Jefferson and Cocke counties in eastern Tennessee.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +11%) soars as Kara Swisher reports Microsoft (MSFT -0.2%) Interactive Entertainment...

    Zynga (ZNGA +11%) soars as Kara Swisher reports Microsoft (MSFT -0.2%) Interactive Entertainment (Xbox division) chief Don Mattrick is leaving, and is set to take a "top job" at Zynga, quite possibly that of CEO. Sources claim an announcement could arrive today. Zynga chairman/CEO Mark Pincus has taken plenty of heat from both investors and employees for his performance; his giant share of Zynga's voting rights should guarantee he'll maintain control of the company whether or not a new CEO is named.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM | 6 Comments
  • INSM

    Lazard says Arikace is "still viable," which will hopefully be some consolation for Insmed (INSM...

    Lazard says Arikace is "still viable," which will hopefully be some consolation for Insmed (INSM -15.4%) shareholders who are taking a rather nasty hit right now courtesy of Phase 3 trial results (previous) which suggested CF patients treated with Novartis' (NVS +0.4%) Tobi performed better on lung function tests — the results were close enough however, to allow INSM to claim statistical non-inferiority. Lazard's Joshua Schimmer reiterates a Buy rating and a $24 price target. Investors are also reminded that UBS believes the drug's real potential might lie in non-tuberculous mycobacteria rather than CF.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • LAKE

    Lakeland Industries (LAKE +4.9%) refinances a TD bank loan (which had technically been in...

    Lakeland Industries (LAKE +4.9%) refinances a TD bank loan (which had technically been in default) with a new $15M senior credit facility, a $3.5M subordinated term loan, and the issuance of warrants. The refinancing crosses from the list one of SA Pro's Whopper Investments' worries when writing a bullish essay one month ago. Of course there's the dilution factor from the warrants, but management calls it "very manageable" and says it's the best of a number of offers made over the last year. The stock's up 42% since the initial article.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • ONXX

    Midday top 10 gainers: ONXX +51%. SPEX +24%. OTC:ACUR +19%. LVB +15%. DM +15%. ARIA +14%. HNR...

    Midday top 10 gainers: ONXX +51%. SPEX +24%. OTC:ACUR +19%. LVB +15%. DM +15%. ARIA +14%. HNR +13%. AXU +13%. TRT +11%. ATAI +11%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: NWSA -54%. INSM -15%. DSS -15%. IDCC -14%. TXMD -12%. HDY -13%. NTS -11%. PME -10%. ALVR -9%. COV -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK +1.8%) completes the previously announced sale of a 50% stake in 850K...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK +1.8%) completes the previously announced sale of a 50% stake in 850K acres in Oklahoma for $1B to China’s Sinopec (NYSE:SNP), and the companies have created a joint venture to operate in the area, sharing exploration and development costs. The area associated with the JV produced 9,600 barrels of liquids and 54M cubic feet of natural gas per day in Q1.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • CDE

    Coeur d'Alene Mines (CDE -4.7%) is downgraded to Underperform with a $10 price target (from...

    Coeur d'Alene Mines (CDE -4.7%) is downgraded to Underperform with a $10 price target (from $16.50) at BMO Capital, which cites relatively high costs at its key La Preciosa project and the expected continuation of the downward trend in silver and gold prices in conjunction with CDE's high all-in-costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • GOL

    Gol Linhas (GOL -2.7%) shrugs off an upbeat initiation at Imperial Capital today to trade lower....

    Gol Linhas (GOL -2.7%) shrugs off an upbeat initiation at Imperial Capital today to trade lower. The firm starts coverage with an Outperform rating and a $6 price target, saying the company is executing its turnaround plan and delivering strong results that aren't factored into the share price, largely due to investor concerns over Brazilian public protests and the weaker Real. Capacity reductions at the airline are moving average fares higher, taking the onus off relying on fare cutting as a traffic generating tool.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • SPEX

    Spherix (SPEX +38.4%) soars after saying it sold $500K worth of Series E convertible preferred...

    Spherix (SPEX +38.4%) soars after saying it sold $500K worth of Series E convertible preferred to "an investor." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • AMSC

    American Superconductor (AMSC +4.7%) adds to its Friday gains after former customer Sinovel says...

    American Superconductor (AMSC +4.7%) adds to its Friday gains after former customer Sinovel says it will divest its U.S., Belgian, Italian, and Canadian units in response to the DOJ's decision to charge the company and two of its employees with stealing wind turbine controller software code from AMSC. AMSC has alleged the stolen code has been used in Sinovel wind turbines deployed in both China and international markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • ONXX

    Mid-sized cancer drug companies are enjoying a boost from Onyx's (ONXX +51%) big run today after...

    Mid-sized cancer drug companies are enjoying a boost from Onyx's (ONXX +51%) big run today after the company rebuffed a low-ball offer from Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN). Ariad Pharmaceutical (ARIA +13%), like ONXX, has a recently approved blood-cancer drug, while Pharmacyclics (PCYC +8%) is considered a leader in developing a treatment for chronic lymphocytic leukemia. With ONXX now on the block, M&A fever is beginning to spread to other firms with takeover potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 2 Comments
  • AU

    Oppenheimer technical analyst Carter Worth thinks the charts for gold and gold miners are so bad...

    Oppenheimer technical analyst Carter Worth thinks the charts for gold and gold miners are so bad they're good, predicting bullion to rally 12.5% to $1,395/oz. and the miners ETF (GDX +1.2%) to climb 10%. AngloGold (AU +2.6%), Goldcorp (GG +1%), Barrick (ABX -3.2%), Newmont (NEM -1.2%) and Silver Wheaton (SLW +3.2%) are among several gold stocks Worth thinks are buys.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 10 Comments
  • HXM

    Mexican real estate developer Homex Development (HXM +4.3%) gets a boost from a Goldman Sachs...

    Mexican real estate developer Homex Development (HXM +4.3%) gets a boost from a Goldman Sachs upgrade to Neutral on valuation. The firm says that the the stock trades at a 22% discount on a price/book basis, instead of a premium like its peers. The reason is due to visibility and liquidity issues the company is facing, but Goldman feels these concerns have already been price into the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • FLTX

    Fleetmatics (FLTX -3.6%) drops after filling a registration statement for an 8M share follow-on...

    Fleetmatics (FLTX -3.6%) drops after filling a registration statement for an 8M share follow-on offering. Sellers will include company officers including the CEO. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • FBIO

    Coronado Biosciences (CNDO -1.9%) slips this morning, despite announcing earlier that it's...

    Coronado Biosciences (CNDO -1.9%) slips this morning, despite announcing earlier that it's completed the enrollment of 250 patients for its Phase 2 clinical trial of TSO, a natural immunomodulator that regulates T-Cells and pro-inflammatory cytokines to treat Crohn's disease. The trial is a U.S. multicenter study designed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of the treatment, with results from a second interim analysis expected in H213.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • REGN

    More on Piper's Regeneron (REGN +4.3%) upgrade: A 20% pull back since mid-May offers an...

    More on Piper's Regeneron (REGN +4.3%) upgrade: A 20% pull back since mid-May offers an "attractive entry point [to] one of the premier biotherapeutic plays in biotech," analyst Edward Tenthoff says, adding that U.S. Eylea sales should come in at $324M for Q2 and $1.368B for the year. Tenthoff also highlights the company's "rich antibody pipeline partnered with Sanofi" as a long-term driver of value. (Previously: Goldman says study supports Eylea over off-label alternatives)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • JKS

    Volatile solar stocks rally (TAN +2.7%) on what's proving a good day for risk assets, as...

    Volatile solar stocks rally (TAN +2.7%) on what's proving a good day for risk assets, as investors decide a weak Chinese manufacturing PMI print was already priced in. JKS +7.5%. SCTY +7.1%. SUNE +6.6%. YGE +4.6%. LDK +6.2%. First Solar (FSLR +4.4%) has announced this morning construction has begun for its 50MW Macho Springs New Mexico solar project, and ReneSola (SOL +6.1%) says it has restrated production at a polysilicon plant (halted in Nov.) following upgrades. ReneSola says the plant now has an annual production capacity of 10K MT, and that it expects to produce 1.8K-2K MT in Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • LGF.A

    Shares of Lions Gate (LGF +5.2%) trade higher as the prospects for a pure-play content company...

    Shares of Lions Gate (LGF +5.2%) trade higher as the prospects for a pure-play content company continue to look enticing with the bidding war for exclusive content raging on. The company also scored a summertime surprise hit with Now You See Me on a pace to record $150M in box office sales off of a production budget of $75M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • TVTY

    Healthways (HWAY -1%) slips this morning on the announcement that it intends to privately offer...

    Healthways (HWAY -1%) slips this morning on the announcement that it intends to privately offer $100M in convertible senior notes due 2018, with an option to purchase up to an additional $15M. The interest rate, conversion rate and other terms of the notes have yet to be determined.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • DRC

    Dresser-Rand (DRC +4.3%) receives a project award from Apex Compressed Air Energy Storage for...

    Dresser-Rand (DRC +4.3%) receives a project award from Apex Compressed Air Energy Storage for the supply of equipment to be used in a new 317 MW compressed air energy storage facility to be constructed in Texas, in a contract valued at ~$200M. DRC says it would be the first CAES facility to be built in the U.S. since 1991.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 3 Comments
  • INTU

    Following a halt, Intuit (INTU +4.3%) rallies in response to news it's selling its financial...

    Following a halt, Intuit (INTU +4.3%) rallies in response to news it's selling its financial services unit (exc. its Mint.com and OFX Connectivity ops) to Thoma Bravo for $1.025B. Intuit also plans to sell its Health Patient Portal business and restructure its accounting professionals unit, and will focus on consumer tax and small business products going forward. The businesses due to be sold are expected to yield FY13 (ends in July) sales of $340M, or less than 8% of estimated revenue. Intuit will use the proceeds of the financial services sale to ramp buyback activity. Raymond James upgraded shares to Strong Buy before news of the deal broke. (May restructuring)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • YRCW

    Shares of YRC Worldwide (YRCW +5.9%) shoot up after BB&T Capital Markers upgrades the...

    Shares of YRC Worldwide (YRCW +5.9%) shoot up after BB&T Capital Markers upgrades the freight company to a Buy rating. The firm created a buzz recently with its Q1 report by recording its first positive operating income in more than a decade.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • GOLD

    Citigroup's Brian Yu cuts his earnings estimates for Barrick Gold (ABX -1.8%) after the miner...

    Citigroup's Brian Yu cuts his earnings estimates for Barrick Gold (ABX -1.8%) after the miner says it will take a $4.5B-$5.5B impairment charge for the Pascua-Lama mine in Q2; he now expects ABX to earn $0.62/share in Q2 from $0.68, $3.04 in 2013 from $3.12, and $2.60 in 2014 from $2.70. Despite numerous setbacks, ABX is the low cost senior gold producer; the firm maintains its Buy rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM

    BioMarin (BMRN +7.2%) submits a marketing application for Vimizim to Brazilian regulators from...

  • ONXX

    Onyx (NASDAQ:ONXX) shares rocket 51% to $130.98 after the company says that it's rejected a...

    Onyx (NASDAQ:ONXX) shares rocket 51% to $130.98 after the company says that it's rejected a $120/share offer from Amgen (AMGN +0.6%) and that it's seeking buyers after receiving inquiries. There's no shortage of speculation about who could acquire Onyx, with Bayer (OTCPK:BAYZF), Celgene (NASDAQ:CELG), Novartis (NYSE:NVS), Bristol-Myers (NYSE:BMY), AstraZeneca (NYSE:AZN), Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY), Gilead (NASDAQ:GILD) and Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) all mentioned. However, Forbes' Matthew Herper notes that potential blockbuster blood-cancer drug Kyprolis has only received accelerated FDA approval, which can be revoked. Big Pharma may have wanted to await further trial results later this year amid concerns about Kyprolis' safety.
